reviews.review_msg: She's really nice and her lectures are interesting. She's scatterbrained, but she tells interesting stories. I'd take a class with her again for sure.

Dr. Galdikas is super knowledgeable and a very nice person, but unfortunately her teaching style is a bit out of touch. Expectations are not clear at all and she's very disorganized. Reading schedule was weird, no specific chapters assigned. Paper had no minimum length, just a maximum. I was always extremely confused with her, can't recommend.

I found Dr. Galdikas to be short tempered and scattered.  Frankly, I was very disappointed.  She is such an accomplished woman, yet I wish I hadn't taken her course.  I had already taken a course on primates at the college level and learned nothing new in Arch 334.  To my surprise we only briefly touched on Orangutans.
Very friendly and takes great pride in his work. Gets very excited about his work and enjoys when students take interested, very sweet :)

This course needs further development.Not sure what we are supposed to come away with as far as learning outcomes.Don't really feel I gained anything from taking class. Charming and nice instructor though.

John is a fair and encouraging instructor. He is easy to talk to and will take the extra time to help students with any given assignment. Arch 334 was engaging and will be beneficial to anyone planning a career in archaeology.
